resources.string: HTTP Toolkit is currently intercepting this device
To intercept this device, start HTTP Toolkit on your computer, and activate Android interception there via QR code or using ADB.
To intercept this device, start HTTP Toolkit on your computer, and activate Android interception there using the ADB or Frida options.
We couldn\'t connect to HTTP Toolkit.\n\nIs it running, and connected to the same network as this device?

Your HTTP Toolkit certificate is not trusted on this device, so HTTPS traffic will only be available from apps that individually include and trust it.\n\nDisconnect and reconnect to rerun HTTPS certificate setup.
HTTPS interception will only be available for apps that are configured to trust user-installed certificates (How?)
Traffic from all intercepted applications will be available, except those using explicit certificate pinning.
Traffic from all intercepted applications will be available, except those using explicit certificate pinning.

HTTP Toolkit sets the device\'s HTTP proxy configuration, to capture traffic from all apps on any port, but some apps may ignore this.\n\nYou can add ports here to forcibly redirect all outgoing traffic to that port, but be careful, as this will interfere with any non-HTTP traffic on these ports.
